item.title: Tarmac sinking in resulting in an about 3 inches deep trough on Springfield Road between Maybourne Close and tennis club., 6th September
item.description:
This issue has occurred a few months after new pipes have been installed on this road. Could this have resulted in a cavity? The trough is deep enough to be dangerous for bicycle riders.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lawrie Park Road, Crystal Palace, London

item.title: Tree felling at 110, 6th September
item.description:
A tree on the fence-line of this property that which was providing significant value in terms of providing greenery and natural surrounding on the road has been felled, changing the view of the road completely. There is a second tree which screens neighbours gardens from buildings which I wish to request is protected as a matter of urgency.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orchard Mews, Hither Green, London

item.title: Collapsing box of waste dumped on street, 6th September
item.description:
A large falling apart box with garden waste, old shoes, broken glass and a metal pole has been dumped on the pavement next to our bins. We don' want the waste left there and the glass and pole falling on the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gables Close, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste including crushed glass dumped all over Craigâ€™s Court, 6th September
item.description:
Craig's Court - bin bags dumped for days on end, crushed glass all over pavement, recycling mixed with general rubbish, food bins attracting vermin. feces, urine, drugs paraphernalia.... why / how is this acceptable? why doesn't the council fine those businesses which repeatedly flaunt laws - especially those pubs who use this public space for example Walker's of Whitehall - to sell alcohol to their customers !? Why aren't they held responsible for cleaning and why can't the court be closed at least once per year to be properly hosed down and washed with the detergent ? Who supervises street cleaners and how can the council justify the state the courtyard is in despite street cleaner even having their own bin !? reduce the number of bins and clean properly - this is so unfair on the local residents...

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Whitehall, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet
